Initial Kitten Vaccination (at or under: Single dose as early as 8 weeks of age, depending on the product. Revaccinate 1 year later
Booster Recommendation: Required annually or every 3 years, depending on vaccine used. State regulations may determine the frequency and type of booster required.
Comments: Core cat vaccine. Rabies is 100% fatal to cats, with no treatment available. Prevention is key.

Initial Kitten Vaccination (at or under: As early as 6 weeks, then every 3-4 weeks until 16 weeks of age
Booster Recommendation: 1 dose is given a year after the last dose of the initial series, then every 3 years.
Comments: Core cat vaccine. Feline distemper is a severe contagious disease that most commonly strikes kittens and can cause death.

Initial Kitten Vaccination (at or under: As early as 6 weeks, then every 3-4 weeks until 16 weeks of age
Booster Recommendation: 1 dose is given a year after the last dose of the initial series, then every 3 years.
Comments: Core cat vaccine. Feline herpesvirus causes feline viral rhinotracheitis (FVR), a very contagious upper respiratory condition.

Initial Kitten Vaccination (at or under: As early as 6 weeks, then every 3-4 weeks until 16 weeks of age
Booster Recommendation: 1 dose is given a year after the last dose of the initial series, then every 3 years.
Comments: Core cat vaccine. A very contagious upper respiratory condition that can cause joint pain, oral ulcerations, fever, and anorexia.

Initial Kitten Vaccination (at or under: As early as 8 weeks, then 3-4 weeks later
Booster Recommendation: Every kitten should get a booster at one year.  If the cat doesn't go outside, no further vaccination is needed unless they are at higher risk. then annually.

Comments: Should test FeLV negative first. Transmitted via cat-to-cat contact. Can cause cancer, immunosuppressant
